Package Game.GameObjects.Pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • Game.Image.ComponentImage
            • Game.GameObjects.Pieces.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ElementGame, ImageFunctions, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Checkers, Pawn, Wizard
    public abstract class Piece
extends ComponentImage
implements ElementGame

    Piece Class

    This class represents the abstraction of the game piece, therefore it encapsulates the logic of movement.
    Since:
    31-08-2021
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece​(java.awt.Color c,
             int p,
             Player ply)
      throws IstanceException
        Parameters:
        c - the color of the piece piece.
        p - the points to be awarded to the player who eats this piece.
        ply - the owner player who has the ability to move the piece.
        Throws:
        IstanceException - CheckersTable getInstance() Exception.

    • Method Detail

      • getPathIMG

        protected abstract java.lang.String getPathIMG()
        Abstract method which is used by the constructor and to be implemented by subclasses.
        Returns:
        the string that represents the path of the image.

      • showSuggestions

        public int showSuggestions​(int direction)
        This method determines the possible movements of the piece that implements it.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the boxes to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        2 if have to eat, 0 otherwise.

      • checkMove

        public int checkMove​(int row,
                     int COL_DIRECTION)
        This method implements the analysis of the box whose coordinates are passed in input.
        Parameters:
        row - row index of the rectangle to be analyzed.
        COL_DIRECTION - col index of the rectangle to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        0 if FIRST box is free so piece can move.
        1 if FIRST box is not free , so piece cannot eat first box or move or because of wizard trying eat another wizard.
        2 if second box is FREE and Piece MUST EAT enemy piece in first box.

      • WizardTryEatWizard

        public boolean WizardTryEatWizard​(java.awt.Point position)
        This method implements the rule that a wizard cannot eat another wizard.
        Parameters:
        position - represents the coordinates of the box containing the enemy piece.
        Returns:
        true if an Wizard try eat another Wizard, else returns false.

      • enemyPiece_inBox

        public int enemyPiece_inBox​(java.awt.Point position)
        This method check if there is an enemy in a box.
        Parameters:
        position - represents the coordinates of the box to analyze.
        Returns:
        1 if piece cannot go over the table or there is a there is a friendly piece.
        2 there is a enemy piece.
        0 rectangle is free.

      • setColonEat

        public int setColonEat​(int col)
        Return the column index of the Box to color when you need to eat.
        Parameters:
        col - column index of the piece to eat.
        Returns:
        the column index of the Box to color when you need to eat.

      • setRowonEat

        public int setRowonEat​(java.awt.Point position)
        Return the row index of the Box to color when you need to eat.
        Parameters:
        position - indicates the rectangle in which the piece to eat is located.
        Returns:
        the row index of the Box to color when you need to eat.

      • setRowbyColor

        public int setRowbyColor()
        Return the row index of the Box to color, it depends on the color of the piece to be moved.
        Returns:
        the row index of the Box to color, it depends on the color of the piece to be moved.

      • setCoord

        public void setCoord​(int x,
                     int y)
        Sets the coordinates of the piece in a two-dimensional data structure.
        Parameters:
        x - row index of the position that the piece occupies in the structure.
        y - column index of the position that the piece occupies in the structure.
